com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.data
Interface NativeMultipleFieldContainer

All Superinterfaces:
NativeCapable, NativeFieldContainer
All Known Subinterfaces:
CPPClass, NativeSeparatedFieldContainer, Structure, Union
public interface NativeMultipleFieldContainer
extends NativeFieldContainer

The NativeMultipleFieldContainer is the interface implemented by native capable classes containing multiple fields like unions, structures and C++ classes.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria

Method Detail

jnieasyGetAbsoluteFieldCount

int jnieasyGetAbsoluteFieldCount()
Returns the absolute number of native fields of this instance.

Returns:
the absolute numbers of fields.
See Also:
NativeMultipleFieldContainerDescriptor.getAbsoluteFieldCount()

jnieasyGetField

java.lang.Object jnieasyGetField(int index,
                                 int fetchMode)
Returns the value of the native field with the specified index and fetch mode.

If instance is native, the field value is synchronized with native memory before returned using the specified fetch mode.

If field is primitive the returned object is a primitive wrapper object.

Parameters:
index - the zero-based index of the field.
fetchMode - the fetch mode to read native memory.
Returns:
the value of the specified field.
See Also:
Fetch

jnieasySetField

void jnieasySetField(int index,
                     java.lang.Object value,
                     int unFetchMode)
Sets a new the value to the native field with the specified index and "unfetch" mode.

If instance is native, the native memory is updated (synchronized) with the new value using the specified "unfetch" mode.

If field is primitive the new value must be a primitive wrapper object.

Parameters:
index - the zero-based index of the field.
value - the new value of the field.
unFetchMode - the "unfetch" mode to write native memory.
See Also:
UnFetch

jnieasyGetField

java.lang.Object jnieasyGetField(int index)
Returns the value of the native field with the specified index and default fetch mode.

Current implementation calls jnieasyGetField(int,int) with the default fetch mode.

Parameters:
index - the zero-based index of the field.
Returns:
the value of the specified field.
See Also:
NativeManager.getDefaultFetchMode()

jnieasySetField

void jnieasySetField(int index,
                     java.lang.Object value)
Sets a new the value to the native field with the specified index and default "unfetch" mode.

Current implementation calls jnieasySetField(int,Object,int) with the default "unfetch" mode.

Parameters:
index - the zero-based index of the field.
value - the new value of the field.
See Also:
NativeManager.getDefaultUnFetchMode()
